department_name: Los Angeles County Department of Public Health - Environmental Health Division

grading_system.description: Uses letter grades A, B, C for scores 70% and above; facilities scoring below 70% receive numerical score cards instead of letter grades

inspection_details.frequency: 1 to 3 times per year based on risk level - frequency determined by food products served, preparation methods, and operational history
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Major Critical Risk Factor violations, facilities scoring below 70% twice in 12 months subject to closure
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Grade/score cards must be posted in area visible to patrons; inspection reports available upon public request

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Los Angeles County Fire Department and local fire authorities
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Semi-annual inspection and certification required every 6 months per NFPA 96; UL-300 compliance required for all systems
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Every 6 months for hood fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CRFC) - part of California Health and Safety Code
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level enforcement - Los Angeles County Environmental Health Division serves as local enforcement agency with delegated state authority
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Los Angeles County Code Title 8 - Consumer Protection, Business and Wage Regulations; exceptions for cities of Long Beach, Pasadena, and Vernon which have own health departments

confidence_notes: Official county ordinance and health department documentation clearly confirms hybrid grading system with letter grades A/B/C for scores 70%+ and numerical score cards for below 70%. Fire safety requirements verified through multiple commercial fire protection sources.
verification_notes: All key information verified from official Los Angeles County sources including specific ordinance text defining grading thresholds and inspection procedures.
